3.text: ([i]Great.[/i] You should have expected this. There was no chance that today would have ended [i]that[/i] easily.)

4.speaker: Marquess Karmina
4.text: I’m glad you finally made it back.

5.speaker: Marquess Karmina
5.text: Even though you didn’t take the carriage I requested to be prepared.

6.speaker: Maverick
6.text: I’m surprised you arrived in one piece. After the scare you gave the coachmen, it’s a real miracle that you made it home.

7.speaker: Marquess Karmina
7.text: Enough, Maverick. Though he is right, what were you thinking Cecilia?

8.speaker: Marquess Karmina
8.text: A girl of your standing, out on the streets alone? The family would be disgraced if any trouble occurred.

9.text: (…Glad to see his priorities are in order.)

10.options: “Please forgive me father. It won’t happen again.”|“I never asked you to prepare a carriage for me.”|“I’m sorry. I just wanted to walk alongside the townspeople today.”|“There was a business matter I needed to handle.”

12.text: (The marquess raises his hand, silencing Maverick and his grievances.)

14.speaker: Marquess Karmina
14.text: As both a marquess and your father, you should treat me with more respect.

15.speaker: Marquess Karmina
15.text: I refuse to accept you acting out like this.

17.text: (You are stunned silent. You expected some pushback, especially from people like Cassius, Esra, and Queen Giselle.)

18.text: (However, Alcinder always seemed a lot more reserved regarding Cecilia’s attitude in [i]Full Blossom[/i]. Sure he disapproved of it, but he never outright scolded her.)

19.text: (At least, he never did somewhere the player could see. It seems you’ve found yet another unexpected difference in the story.)

20.text: (You realize that the roster of people opposing Cecilia, and therefore you, is much longer than you initially thought.)

21.speaker: Marquess Karmina
21.text: I truly hope you understand what I’m saying.

22.speaker: Marquess Karmina
22.text: Well, no matter. At the end of the day, it's of no consequence, so long as you [i]correct[/i] that behavior.

23.speaker: Maverick
23.text: Is this your attempt at hiding your newest shady business?

24.speaker: Maverick
24.text: I mean, who are you kidding with this bul-

25.text: (The marquess raises his hand, silencing Maverick and his grievances.)

27.speaker: Marquess Karmina
27.text: While I agree with your objections, we have to try and trust your sister.

28.text: (Maverick’s head hangs in shame as Alcinder turns to face you.)

29.speaker: Marquess Karmina
29.text: Cecilia, I am choosing to trust in you.

30.speaker: Marquess Karmina
30.text: That does not mean I believe what you are saying. In fact, I think your brother is rightfully suspicious given your past behavior.

31.speaker: Marquess Karmina
31.text: However, if you are being truthful, I want to support your endeavors to connect with our subjects.

32.speaker: Marquess Karmina
32.text: Just know that if this is another one of your ploys, there will be consequences.

33.speaker: Marquess Karmina
33.text: We [i]will[/i] discuss them in the future if the need ever arises, but I will move away from that topic for now.

35.speaker: Marquess Karmina
35.text: You have to work hard to maintain a decent relationship with Lord Akatius.

36.speaker: Marquess Karmina
36.text: As the Demon Lands neighbor our territory, it’s important we retain an amicable relationship with them. I don’t need your temper to sour that.

38.speaker: “Cecilia”
38.text: I would never take an action that would sully the de Karmina name.

40.speaker: Marquess Karmina
40.text: If you keep this up, you might have a positive reputation amongst the nobility.

41.text: (You grit your teeth at his backhanded remark. While his words are rude, it seems like he’s trying to genuinely look out for Cecilia.)

42.speaker: “Cecilia”
42.text: Thank you for your kind words, Father.

43.speaker: “Cecilia”
43.text: It means a lot that you care.

44.text: (Flashing a bright smile right now should make your words seem more sincere.)

45.speaker: Marquess Karmina
45.text: You should start acting appropriately for a noble of our status.

46.speaker: Marquess Karmina
46.text: Think of all the blemishes you’ve brought to the de Karmina name just in one day.

47.text: (Your brows furrow at his remarks. Even if he is trying to genuinely look out for Cecilia, you can’t let him treat you like a child.)

49.speaker: “Cecilia”
49.text: Every action I take is with the de Karmina name in mind.

50.speaker: “Cecilia”
50.text: Regardless, I will heed your words.

51.speaker: Marquess Karmina
51.text: However, you’re still a Karmina. Never allow others to walk all over you.

52.text: (You grit your teeth at his unsolicited advice. While his words are harsh, it seems like he’s trying to genuinely look out for Cecilia.)

54.text: (If you bow your head, you might be able to garner more sympathy from him.)

55.speaker: “Cecilia”
55.text: I will take your words to heart.

56.speaker: Marquess Karmina
56.text: You should visit a doctor when you have the chance.

57.speaker: Marquess Karmina
57.text: We wouldn’t want you to cause trouble while you’re not in a proper state of mind.

58.text: (You grit your teeth at his unsolicited advice. While his words are rude, it seems like he’s trying to genuinely look out for Cecilia.)

60.speaker: “Cecilia”
60.text: I will be sure to keep your words in mind.

61.speaker: Marquess Karmina
61.text: Alas, now that you [i]both[/i] are here, I have an announcement to make.

62.speaker: Marquess Karmina
62.text: This morning I received a letter from His Highness. A royal ball has been scheduled to take place [b]one month[/b] from today.

63.speaker: Marquess Karmina
63.text: It will be the court’s official welcome to the demon ambassador, so I expect both of you to be well prepared for the event and that you’ll be on your [i]best[/i] behavior.

64.text: (You don’t even need to look to know Maverick is glaring at you. You can almost feel the sharp pain of being stabbed by the daggers he’s staring your way.)

65.speaker: Marquess Karmina
65.text: With that, I’ll retire to my study for the night.

66.speaker: Marquess Karmina
66.text: I fear I’ve lost my appetite.

67.text: (...It’s even more tense now that only you and Maverick are left.)

68.text: (You’ll just leave quietly and get out while you can.)

69.speaker: Maverick
69.text: Cecilia, let’s chat for a moment.

70.text: (Damnit. Okay. Let’s get this over with.)

71.options: “Did I do something wrong?”|“This better be important. My time is precious.”|“Anytime. I love speaking with my dear brother.”|Don’t say anything.

72.speaker: Maverick
72.text: You could accomplish so much more for the family, but you continue to let this poor reputation hold you back.

73.speaker: Maverick
73.text: Remember, your actions affect more than just yourself.

74.speaker: Maverick
74.text: I’m glad you’re finally listening to me, but you still have a reputation to uphold.

75.speaker: Maverick
75.text: Be more careful about your appearance. We wouldn’t want any stains on the family name.

76.speaker: Maverick
76.text: Remember, your actions affect more than just yourself.

77.speaker: Maverick
77.text: Really, I don’t understand why you aren’t kinder to Father.

78.speaker: Maverick
78.text: He does a lot for you.

79.speaker: Maverick
79.text: The next month will be busy, you should get some rest.

80.speaker: Maverick
80.text: Beatrice! Please escort Cecilia back to her room.

81.speaker: Beatrice
81.text: Have a good night, Lady Cecilia.

82.text: (The maid rushes off, eager to get away from you as quickly as possible.)

83.text: (Maintaining appearances as the villainess is exhausting and isolating. It’s as though Cecilia is the only person you can rely on.)

84.text: (Improving your relationship with them could be useful for extending your influence on the Karmina estate.)

85.text: (You’ll have to be careful around Maverick. It seems like he’s constantly watching Cecilia’s every move.)

86.text: (At least he hasn’t caught onto you yet. You guess that’s one good thing about his simplemindedness.)

87.text: (But as much as you hate it, he’s right about one thing. This is going to be a tough month and you need to make the most of your time.)

88.text: (You finally head off to sleep, closing the book on this long first day of your new life as the villainess.)

89.text: (Your vision fades to black and the last thing you can see are blooming chrysanthemums in the corner of your room.)

please_forgive.text: (The marquess’s face remains perfectly expressionless. He seems completely unphased by your words.)

walk_townspeople.text: (Both Maverick and Alcinder give you strange looks as if they couldn’t believe what they just heard.)

business_matter.text: (The marquess’s face remains perfectly expressionless. He seems completely unphased by your words.)

ooc_under_1.speaker: Marquess Karmina
ooc_under_1.text: I heard about what happened at the luncheon.

ooc_5_1.speaker: Marquess Karmina
ooc_5_1.text: I heard you’ve been behaving differently today.

silly_response_2.speaker: Marquess Karmina
silly_response_2.text: I’m proud to see you’re finally acting in a manner befitting a lady.

girlboss_response_2.speaker: Marquess Karmina
girlboss_response_2.text: I’m ashamed that you appear to be…[i]even less ladylike[/i] now.

meek_response_2.speaker: Marquess Karmina
meek_response_2.text: I’m glad to see you finally decided to drop that standoffish attitude.

other_response_2.speaker: Marquess Karmina
other_response_2.text: Are you perhaps feeling ill at all?

rejoin_1.text: (It seems like dinner is becoming yet another awkward meal…You should just try to get through it as quickly as possible.)

something_wrong.speaker: Maverick
something_wrong.text: …I don’t have time for your sarcasm.

time_precious.text: (Maverick sighs, a deep furrow forming in his brow. But…he doesn’t look surprised.)

dear_brother.speaker: Maverick
dear_brother.text: …I don’t have time for your sarcasm.

ooc_under_2.speaker: Maverick
ooc_under_2.text: You should really put more effort into how other people see you, sister.

ooc_5_2.speaker: Maverick
ooc_5_2.text: Something has changed about you today, sister.

maverick_scold.speaker: Maverick
maverick_scold.text: And you should learn when to hold your tongue.

rejoin_2.speaker: Maverick
rejoin_2.text: That’s all I have to say for tonight.

mimic_response_1.text: (It’s an expected response given Cecilia’s reputation, but it still stings a little.)

other_response_3.text: (It makes sense that just one day of changing Cecilia’s behavior won’t affect how the staff treats you, but it wouldn’t hurt to keep things up.)

rejoin_3.text: (However, that’s the least of your concerns.)
